name: TheAtlantic
text: Because school closures created a crisis for working parents, it’s tempting to see adding school back into the equation as the solution, @ashleyfetters writes. But there are less dangerous ways to help families than fully reopening schools as they were: https://t.co/GFXaCOgMHv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Absent the usual summer blockbusters, the landscape of American entertainment is barren enough for C- shows and movies to rack up the viewership of B+ productions, Hannah Giorgis writes. https://t.co/OYoyfbn2lg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As long as America proves capable of delivering a safe and effective vaccine to its citizens, it will contain the coronavirus," @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/XZtC38EmBt

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2020 may offer Democrats their best chance yet to take back state legislatures across the country, just in time for redistricting to begin in 2021, @RonBrownstein writes: https://t.co/4dfKPOH15d

name: TheAtlantic
text: When her first novels were published, in the mid-1970s, Gayl Jones’s talent was hailed by writers from James Baldwin to John Updike, @Calsdesk writes. Then she disappeared. Now she’s releasing her first novel in more than 20 years. https://t.co/6qdNLHz6eK

name: TheAtlantic
text: The South China Morning Post is arguably the world’s most important newspaper for what it tells us about media freedoms as China’s power grows. @TMcLaughlin3 looks inside a newsroom at the edge of autocracy: https://t.co/GTDjoCExrj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "You have met Facts Man before if you have spent any time online in the past half decade or so. He’s inescapable. He podcasts. He makes YouTube videos. He traffics in Medium posts," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/0porqqKur7

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If campuses reopen to students but most faculty teach remotely, students and administrators who show up might see more clearly how staff are the connective tissue holding campuses together," writes @jselingo. https://t.co/s5LqR4oMfH

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As the president suggests postponing the election, it’s important to understand the hazards ahead, and the timelines and decision points that may prove crucial," writes @DavidFrum. https://t.co/p2Fd4xeBmm

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Two summers ago, Idrissa Camara was summoned to an ICE field office. He had no idea of the damage to come, @chrisoutcalt writes.
https://t.co/EuJx2c9lfB

name: TheAtlantic
text: By coding caste in harmless-sounding phrases like “similar backgrounds,” Netflix’s hit series “Indian Matchmaking” does exactly what many upper-caste families tend to do when discussing this subject—they make it invisible, @YashicaDutt argues. https://t.co/boqx11N5GA
